qas.question: How much of the population depends on agriculture?
How much more is the per capita GDP in Namibia compared to the rest of Africa's countries?
Where does a majority of Namibia's people live?
Namibia has one of the highest rates of what type of income problems in the world?
How much of Namibia's land is arable?
How much of Africa's poorest countries land is arable?
From where does Namibia import food?
What countries have an even higher rate of income disparity than Namibia?
In Africa's poorest countries in which industry do most people work?

context: About <a0_0>half<a0_0/> of the population depends on <b8_0>agriculture<b8_0/> (largely subsistence agriculture) for its livelihood, but Namibia must still import some of its food. Although per capita GDP is <a1_0>five times<a1_0/> the per capita GDP of <b6_0><b7_0>Africa's poorest countries<b7_0/><b6_0/>, the majority of Namibia's people live in <a2_0>rural<a2_0/> areas and exist on a subsistence way of life. Namibia has one of the highest rates of income <a3_0>inequality<a3_0/> in the world, due in part to the fact that there is an urban economy and a more rural cash-less economy. The inequality figures thus take into account people who do not actually rely on the formal economy for their survival. Although arable land accounts for only <a4_0><b5_0>1%<b5_0/><a4_0/> of Namibia, nearly half of the population is employed in agriculture.
